definition: Feng Doubo or Feng Wu (1672-), calligrapher of the Ming-Qing transition/also called 馮竇伯|冯窦伯[Feng2 Dou4 bo2]
surname Feng
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
surname Wu
martial/military
History of Chen of the Southern Dynasties, ninth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Yao Silian 姚思廉[Yao2 Si1 lian2] in 636 during Tang dynasty, 36 scrolls
Zhao Yi (1727-1814), Qing dynasty poet and historian, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
surname Yun
Liu Xi (late Han, c. 200 AD), possibly the author of 釋名|释名[Shi4 ming2]
Chu Renhuo (17th century), author of historical novel Dramatized History of Sui and Tang 隋唐演義|隋唐演义
Wang Zhu (-c. 990), Song calligrapher and writer
Liu Xiang (77-6 BC), Han Dynasty scholar and author
Li Yanshou (fl. 650), compiler of History of the Southern 南史 and Northern Dynasties 北史
Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
Yuan Mei (1716-1798), famous Qing poet and critic, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Chu Suiliang (596-659), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Wang Chong (27-97), rationalist and critical philosopher

History of Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4] or Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], sixth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Shen Yue 沈約|沈约[Shen2 Yue4] in 488 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 100 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋史[Song4 shi3])
